verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah , which \add was\add* the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar.
For then the king of Babylon’s army besieged Jerusalem : and Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the prison , which \add was\add* in the king of Judah’s house.

For Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up , saying , Wherefore dost thou prophesy , and say , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon , and he shall take it;

And Zedekiah king of Judah shall not escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans , but shall surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon , and shall speak with him mouth to mouth , and his eyes shall behold his eyes ;
And he shall lead Zedekiah to Babylon , and there shall he be until I visit him, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: though ye fight with the Chaldeans , ye shall not prosper. \p
¶ And Jeremiah said , The word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came unto me, saying ,
Behold, Hanameel the son of Shallum thine uncle shall come unto thee, saying , Buy thee my field that \add is\add* in Anathoth : for the right of redemption \add is\add* thine to buy \add it\add*.

So Hanameel mine uncle’s son came to me in the court of the prison according to the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and said unto me, Buy my field , I pray thee, that \add is\add* in Anathoth , which \add is\add* in the country of Benjamin : for the right of inheritance \add is\add* thine, and the redemption \add is\add* thine; buy \add it\add* for thyself. Then I knew that this \add was\add* the word of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

And I bought the field of Hanameel my uncle’s son , that \add was\add* in Anathoth , and weighed him the money , \add even\add* seventeen shekels of silver.\f + \fr 32.9 \ft seventeen…: or, seven shekels and ten pieces of silver\f*
And I subscribed the evidence , and sealed \add it\add*, and took witnesses , and weighed \add him\add* the money in the balances.\f + \fr 32.10 \ft subscribed…: Heb. wrote in the book\f*
So I took the evidence of the purchase , \add both\add* that which was sealed \add according\add* to the law and custom , and that which was open :

And I gave the evidence of the purchase unto Baruch the son of Neriah , the son of Maaseiah , in the sight of Hanameel mine uncle’s \add son\add*, and in the presence of the witnesses that subscribed the book of the purchase , before all the Jews that sat in the court of the prison. \p
¶ And I charged Baruch before them, saying ,

Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , the God of Israel ; Take these evidences , this evidence of the purchase , both which is sealed , and this evidence which is open ; and put them in an earthen vessel , that they may continue many days.
For thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , the God of Israel ; Houses and fields and vineyards shall be possessed again in this land. \p
¶ Now when I had delivered the evidence of the purchase unto Baruch the son of Neriah , I prayed unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, saying ,

Ah Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*! behold, thou hast made the heaven and the earth by thy great power and stretched out arm , \add and\add* there is nothing too hard for thee:\f + \fr 32.17 \ft too…: or, hid from thee\f*

Thou shewest lovingkindness unto thousands , and recompensest the iniquity of the fathers into the bosom of their children after them: the Great , the Mighty God , the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , \add is\add* his name ,

Great in counsel , and mighty in work : for thine eyes \add are\add* open upon all the ways of the sons of men : to give every one according to his ways , and according to the fruit of his doings :\f + \fr 32.19 \ft work: Heb. doing\f*
Which hast set signs and wonders in the land of Egypt , \add even\add* unto this day , and in Israel , and among \add other\add* men ; and hast made thee a name , as at this day ;
And hast brought forth thy people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs , and with wonders , and with a strong hand , and with a stretched out arm , and with great terror ;
And hast given them this land , which thou didst swear to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey ;

And they came in , and possessed it; but they obeyed not thy voice , neither walked in thy law ; they have done nothing of all that thou commandedst them to do : therefore thou hast caused all this evil to come upon them:

Behold the mounts , they are come unto the city to take it; and the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans , that fight against it, because of the sword , and of the famine , and of the pestilence : and what thou hast spoken is come to pass; and, behold, thou seest \add it\add*.\f + \fr 32.24 \ft mounts: or, engines of shot\f*

And thou hast said unto me, O Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*, Buy thee the field for money , and take witnesses ; for the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.\f + \fr 32.25 \ft for the: or, though the\f* \p
¶ Then came the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto Jeremiah , saying ,
Behold, I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the God of all flesh : is there any thing too hard for me?

Therefore thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans , and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon , and he shall take it:

And the Chaldeans , that fight against this city , shall come and set fire on this city , and burn it with the houses , upon whose roofs they have offered incense unto Baal , and poured out drink offerings unto other gods , to provoke me to anger.

For the children of Israel and the children of Judah have only done evil before me from their youth : for the children of Israel have only provoked me to anger with the work of their hands , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

For this city hath been to me \add as\add* a provocation of mine anger and of my fury from the day that they built it even unto this day ; that I should remove it from before my face ,\f + \fr 32.31 \ft a provocation…: Heb. for my anger\f*

Because of all the evil of the children of Israel and of the children of Judah , which they have done to provoke me to anger , they, their kings , their princes , their priests , and their prophets , and the men of Judah , and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

And they have turned unto me the back , and not the face : though I taught them, rising up early and teaching \add them\add*, yet they have not hearkened to receive instruction.\f + \fr 32.33 \ft back: Heb. neck\f*
But they set their abominations in the house , which is called by my name , to defile it.

And they built the high places of Baal , which \add are\add* in the valley of the son of Hinnom , to cause their sons and their daughters to pass through \add the fire\add* unto Molech ; which I commanded them not, neither came it into my mind , that they should do this abomination , to cause Judah to sin. \p

¶ And now therefore thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, the God of Israel , concerning this city , whereof ye say , It shall be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon by the sword , and by the famine , and by the pestilence ;

Behold, I will gather them out of all countries , whither I have driven them in mine anger , and in my fury , and in great wrath ; and I will bring them again unto this place , and I will cause them to dwell safely :
And they shall be my people , and I will be their God :
And I will give them one heart , and one way , that they may fear me for ever , for the good of them, and of their children after them:\f + \fr 32.39 \ft for ever: Heb. all days\f*

And I will make an everlasting covenant with them, that I will not turn away from them , to do them good ; but I will put my fear in their hearts , that they shall not depart from me.\f + \fr 32.40 \ft from them: Heb. from after them\f*
Yea, I will rejoice over them to do them good , and I will plant them in this land assuredly with my whole heart and with my whole soul.\f + \fr 32.41 \ft assuredly: Heb. in truth, or, stability\f*
For thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; Like as I have brought all this great evil upon this people , so will I bring upon them all the good that I have promised them.
And fields shall be bought in this land , whereof ye say , \add It is\add* desolate without man or beast ; it is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.

Men shall buy fields for money , and subscribe evidences , and seal \add them\add*, and take witnesses in the land of Benjamin , and in the places about Jerusalem , and in the cities of Judah , and in the cities of the mountains , and in the cities of the valley , and in the cities of the south : for I will cause their captivity to return , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
